data.what_is:
Postman is the world's leading API platform, used by more than 30 million developers and 500,000 organizations worldwide for building and managing APIs. 

Postman enables teams to efficiently collaborate at every stage of the API lifecycle while prioritizing quality, performance, and security.

initial_reviews.review_title: Sharing my experience of using Postman for more than one and a half year
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Having utilized Postman for over a year and a half as a backend developer, I can attest to its indispensable role in my backend development journey.

Postman has been a support for me in backend development. Its intuitive interface made it easy for me to dive in, even as a beginner. I find myself using it frequently for everything from basic API testing to advanced tasks like WebSocket and gRPC integration. Postman's simplicity and reliability make it my go-to tool every day, whether I'm working solo or collaborating with teammates.

One more thing is you're capable of creating environmental variable in collection scope and global scope. So, no need to changing values on multiple places.

What do you dislike about Postman?
While it was easy to use, but there is a downside that the documentation is not user friendly for begginer. In the beginning when I had to read the documentation regarding Mock test, it was somehow difficult to understand what the writer wants to say. I had to take the help of available blogs on other sites.
Please update the documentation and make it simple.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
The main problem it solved it you can test the APIs smoothly with a better UI interface, and can create and share the collection with teammates easily.

initial_reviews.review_title: Best Tool for API testing
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
I have used Postman for API testing for my Java project. It is very helpful for backend API testing, also there are multiple ways in which we can send and receive our data from the API.

What do you dislike about Postman?
It is GUI intensive and it has limited offline functionality.
Apart from this, the documentation of the errors that occurred should be properly written.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Suppose you are a Full Stack Developer or someone who is working on the backend, You are working on a project that has some API's and you want to test whether the dataset received from the API is correct or not, The Postman tool will help you a lot, apart from this, If you have integrated Security to your Website or Backend It Also allows you to pass the tokens and the params necessary for your API.

initial_reviews.review_title: API Testing Made Simple and Efficient
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
A user-friendly interface that simplifies testing APIs efficiently. Clean UI, easy to use which makes the life of testing APIs easy.

What do you dislike about Postman?
There is a learning curve, initially, when I started using Postman I found myself looking into the documentation more than what I could think of. Also, I get too many notifications, which I don't like.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman has solved so many problems that I used to face before adopting.

Like, for the API testing, I used to use command line tools like curl and wget. Now with Postman, with its simple interface, I can easily send requests, get responses, and make sure that everything is working fine.
Easily switching between different environments and having variables support which can be used in request headers etc., are life-saving. Being a Python backend developer, who builds the APIs too frequently, Postman makes my life easier.

Also, documenting APIs was a painful task for me, but now with Postman, I'm able to generate documentation easily.

initial_reviews.review_title: PostMan - Review
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
I primarily use PostMan as a means to test internal systems via REST API Calls

What do you dislike about Postman?
I dont like that I now am required to create a log in to fully use the product, but I do see the benefits of it.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Although there are other tools availble for the work I do (ie SOAPUi). PostMan is free for use. It does require a user login to fully utilize the tool and it's feature like Collections and Environments. The nice feature with the login for PostMan is that your "loaded" API Collections follow you where you are logged in. As a trainer I work locally for some projects and on others (the majority of the time) , I am using a Virtual Machine. All I have to do is open PostMan and log in and everything is "loaded" and ready for use.

initial_reviews.review_title: The one and only option for api securty testing
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
There are lots of tools for api testing, but none of them provide integration for proxy and more collaboration-based functions, like the ability to export all collections to JSON and import other collections. They have really good user-friendly interfaces, and the best thing I feel is pre-request scripts. Pre-request scripts are really helpful for me as a pentester.

What do you dislike about Postman?
When we try to import a large collection, most of the time it will crash if you have low specs.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Shearing API endpoints,knowledge and requests from the development team to the security team will be kind of hard if post-man doesn't exist. and getting the requests in burpsutes( a testing application) will never happen without  postman proxy.

initial_reviews.review_title: Fastest way to test API endpoints
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Easily organize many APIs and their endpoints, the ability to use placeholders and set environments, automatic prettifying JSON (input). Good support for different types of authentication, very clean UI, just works very efficiently.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Rendering large JSON responses can get a bit slow, no numbering of JSON items in a list when collapsing (no easy way to see e.g. number of items in response).

Sharing with team members is a paid feature.

The editor to add documentation is limited.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Ability to quickly test API endpoints with different settings & environments.
Document how to use APIs and individual endpoints.

initial_reviews.review_title: Lightweight API client to create different API requests
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is a very simplified tool to execute API requests and their different operations like GET, PUT and POST. It is very easy to install and also learn, even for a new user. We use it almost thrice a week to execute different REST and SOAP APIs using JSON and XML request formats, and then validate the responses.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Now, Postman has made its services chargeable, with licenses, if you want to save the existing requests in workspaces. So, that is one issue. Other than that, rest everything is fine.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman is a very good tool to accomplish API request and response validations. Moreover, this also helps in testing API automation, with tools like Selenium to verify if the API endpoint is returning correct values or not. Instead of worrying about the slow load of front-end applications, it is easier to just validate the backend services of APIs using Postman, hence that saves a lot of time and effort.

initial_reviews.review_title: Postman: Your Essential Tool for Testing APIs
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is a widely used API development tool that enables developers to design, test, and document APIs. Its features include automated testing for bug detection, an intuitive interface for creating and executing requests, and the ability to organize requests into collections for efficient management and sharing.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Postman presents a user-friendly interface, yet beginners may find its learning curve challenging. Users have encountered occasional performance issues with the desktop version, notably with large collections or complex requests, causing slow response times and memory concerns.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman's solutions streamline the API development process, improve collaboration and communication among team members, and ensure the reliability and performance of APIs. These benefits ultimately lead to faster development cycles, higher-quality APIs, and better user experiences for developers and end-users alike.

When it comes to testing APIs and their responses, Postman is a lifesaver for users.

In my opinion, Postman is the best tool currently available for dealing with APIs since it satisfies the demands of customers on a daily basis and allows them to have a single platform that handles all of this.

In conclusion, the most significant issues I have with Postman include the complexity of its more sophisticated functionality and the lack of current documentation.

I believe that Postman has room to grow in these areas to provide an even better experience for its users.

I use Postman on a daily basis and like using it to test and connect with APIs.
Postman is compatible with several API types, such as REST and SOAP which helps me to be more productive.

all_reviews.review_title: Sharing my experience of using Postman for more than one and a half year
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Having utilized Postman for over a year and a half as a backend developer, I can attest to its indispensable role in my backend development journey.

Postman has been a support for me in backend development. Its intuitive interface made it easy for me to dive in, even as a beginner. I find myself using it frequently for everything from basic API testing to advanced tasks like WebSocket and gRPC integration. Postman's simplicity and reliability make it my go-to tool every day, whether I'm working solo or collaborating with teammates.

One more thing is you're capable of creating environmental variable in collection scope and global scope. So, no need to changing values on multiple places.

What do you dislike about Postman?
While it was easy to use, but there is a downside that the documentation is not user friendly for begginer. In the beginning when I had to read the documentation regarding Mock test, it was somehow difficult to understand what the writer wants to say. I had to take the help of available blogs on other sites.
Please update the documentation and make it simple.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
The main problem it solved it you can test the APIs smoothly with a better UI interface, and can create and share the collection with teammates easily.

all_reviews.review_title: API Testing Made Simple and Efficient
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
A user-friendly interface that simplifies testing APIs efficiently. Clean UI, easy to use which makes the life of testing APIs easy.

What do you dislike about Postman?
There is a learning curve, initially, when I started using Postman I found myself looking into the documentation more than what I could think of. Also, I get too many notifications, which I don't like.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman has solved so many problems that I used to face before adopting.

Like, for the API testing, I used to use command line tools like curl and wget. Now with Postman, with its simple interface, I can easily send requests, get responses, and make sure that everything is working fine.
Easily switching between different environments and having variables support which can be used in request headers etc., are life-saving. Being a Python backend developer, who builds the APIs too frequently, Postman makes my life easier.

Also, documenting APIs was a painful task for me, but now with Postman, I'm able to generate documentation easily.

all_reviews.review_title: PostMan - Review

What do you dislike about Postman?

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Although there are other tools availble for the work I do (ie SOAPUi). PostMan is free for use. It does require a user login to fully utilize the tool and it's feature like Collections and Environments. The nice feature with the login for PostMan is that your "loaded" API Collections follow you where you are logged in. As a trainer I work locally for some projects and on others (the majority of the time) , I am using a Virtual Machine. All I have to do is open PostMan and log in and everything is "loaded" and ready for use.

all_reviews.review_title: The one and only option for api securty testing
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
There are lots of tools for api testing, but none of them provide integration for proxy and more collaboration-based functions, like the ability to export all collections to JSON and import other collections. They have really good user-friendly interfaces, and the best thing I feel is pre-request scripts. Pre-request scripts are really helpful for me as a pentester.

What do you dislike about Postman?
When we try to import a large collection, most of the time it will crash if you have low specs.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Shearing API endpoints,knowledge and requests from the development team to the security team will be kind of hard if post-man doesn't exist. and getting the requests in burpsutes( a testing application) will never happen without  postman proxy.

Sharing with team members is a paid feature.

The editor to add documentation is limited.

Ability to quickly test API endpoints with different settings & environments.
Document how to use APIs and individual endpoints.

all_reviews.review_title: Lightweight API client to create different API requests
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is a very simplified tool to execute API requests and their different operations like GET, PUT and POST. It is very easy to install and also learn, even for a new user. We use it almost thrice a week to execute different REST and SOAP APIs using JSON and XML request formats, and then validate the responses.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Now, Postman has made its services chargeable, with licenses, if you want to save the existing requests in workspaces. So, that is one issue. Other than that, rest everything is fine.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman is a very good tool to accomplish API request and response validations. Moreover, this also helps in testing API automation, with tools like Selenium to verify if the API endpoint is returning correct values or not. Instead of worrying about the slow load of front-end applications, it is easier to just validate the backend services of APIs using Postman, hence that saves a lot of time and effort.

all_reviews.review_title: Postman: Your Essential Tool for Testing APIs
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is a widely used API development tool that enables developers to design, test, and document APIs. Its features include automated testing for bug detection, an intuitive interface for creating and executing requests, and the ability to organize requests into collections for efficient management and sharing.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Postman presents a user-friendly interface, yet beginners may find its learning curve challenging. Users have encountered occasional performance issues with the desktop version, notably with large collections or complex requests, causing slow response times and memory concerns.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman's solutions streamline the API development process, improve collaboration and communication among team members, and ensure the reliability and performance of APIs. These benefits ultimately lead to faster development cycles, higher-quality APIs, and better user experiences for developers and end-users alike.

all_reviews.review_title: Unlocking API Potential: Postman's Power in Building, Testing, and Managing with Ease!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Within Postman, users have the ability to construct new API collections. They can also test all four kinds of APIs--get, put, post, and delete--to get the response they need.

Postman is an open-source platform that allows users to test and manage APIs. It includes several functionalities.
When it comes to testing APIs and their responses, Postman is a lifesaver for users.

What do you dislike about Postman?
In my opinion, Postman is the best tool currently available for dealing with APIs since it satisfies the demands of customers on a daily basis and allows them to have a single platform that handles all of this.

In conclusion, the most significant issues I have with Postman include the complexity of its more sophisticated functionality and the lack of current documentation.

I believe that Postman has room to grow in these areas to provide an even better experience for its users.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I use Postman on a daily basis and like using it to test and connect with APIs.
Postman is compatible with several API types, such as REST and SOAP which helps me to be more productive.
